name: 腓利门书
description: 保罗写给腓利门的私人书信，请求他宽恕并接纳逃跑的奴隶阿尼西母

verses.zh: 为基督耶稣被囚的保罗，同兄弟提摩太，写信给我们亲爱的同工腓利门，
verses.en: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our dear friend and fellow worker—

verses.zh: 和妹子亚腓亚，并与我们同当兵的亚基布，以及在你家的教会。
verses.en: also to Apphia our sister and Archippus our fellow soldier—and to the church that meets in your home:

verses.zh: 愿恩惠、平安从神我们的父和主耶稣基督归与你们！
verses.en: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.zh: 我祷告的时候提到你，常为你感谢我的神；
verses.en: I always thank my God as I remember you in my prayers,

verses.zh: 因听见你向主耶稣的信心，并向众圣徒的爱心。
verses.en: because I hear about your love for all his holy people and your faith in the Lord Jesus.

verses.zh: 愿你与人所同有的信心显出功效，使人知道你们各样善事都是为基督作的。
verses.en: I pray that your partnership with us in the faith may be effective in deepening your understanding of every good thing we share for the sake of Christ.

verses.zh: 兄弟啊，我为你的爱心大有快乐，大得安慰，因众圣徒的心从你得了畅快。
verses.en: Your love has given me great joy and encouragement, because you, brother, have refreshed the hearts of the Lord's people.

verses.zh: 我虽然靠着基督能放胆吩咐你合宜的事，
verses.en: Therefore, although in Christ I could be bold and order you to do what you ought to do,

verses.zh: 然而像我这有年纪的保罗，现在又是为基督耶稣被囚的，宁可凭着爱心求你，
verses.en: yet I prefer to appeal to you on the basis of love. It is as none other than Paul—an old man and now also a prisoner of Christ Jesus—

verses.zh: 就是为我在捆锁中所生的儿子阿尼西母求你。
verses.en: that I appeal to you for my son Onesimus, who became my son while I was in chains.

verses.zh: 他从前与你没有益处，但如今与你我都有益处。
verses.en: Formerly he was useless to you, but now he has become useful both to you and to me.

verses.zh: 我现在打发他亲自回你那里去，他是我心上的人。
verses.en: I am sending him—who is my very heart—back to you.

verses.zh: 我本来有意将他留下，在我为福音所受的捆锁中替你伺候我。
verses.en: I would have liked to keep him with me so that he could take your place in helping me while I am in chains for the gospel.

verses.zh: 但不知道你的意思，我就不愿意这样行，叫你的善行不是出于勉强，乃是出于甘心。
verses.en: But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that any favor you do would not seem forced but would be voluntary.

verses.zh: 或者他暂时离开你，是特要叫你永远得着他。
verses.en: Perhaps the reason he was separated from you for a little while was that you might have him back forever—

verses.zh: 不再是奴仆，乃是高过奴仆，是亲爱的兄弟。在我实在是如此，何况在你呢！这也不仅在肉身，在主里更是如此。
verses.en: no longer as a slave, but better than a slave, as a dear brother. He is very dear to me but even dearer to you, both as a fellow man and as a brother in the Lord.

verses.zh: 你若以我为同伴，就收纳他，如同收纳我一样。
verses.en: So if you consider me a partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.

verses.zh: 他若亏负你，或欠你什么，都归在我的账上。
verses.en: If he has done you any wrong or owes you anything, charge it to me.

verses.zh: 我必偿还。这是我保罗亲笔写的。我并不用对你说，连你自己也是亏欠于我。
verses.en: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand. I will pay it back—not to mention that you owe me your very self.

verses.zh: 兄弟啊，望你使我在主里因你得着益处，在基督里使我的心畅快。
verses.en: I do, dear brother, that I may have some benefit from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.

verses.zh: 我写信给你，深信你必顺服，知道你所要行的必过于我所说的。
verses.en: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.

verses.zh: 此外你还要给我预备住处，因为我盼望藉着你们的祷告，必蒙恩赐给你们。
verses.en: And one thing more: Prepare a guest room for me, because I hope to be restored to you in answer to your prayers.

verses.zh: 为基督耶稣与我同坐监的以巴弗问你安。
verses.en: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings.

verses.zh: 与我同工的马可、亚里达古、底马、路加也都问你安。
verses.en: And so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas and Luke, my fellow workers.

verses.zh: 愿我们主耶稣基督的恩常在你的心里。阿们！
verses.en: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
